text: Incident Response is an organized approach to addressing and managing
the threat or violation of security policies and standard practices.
A quick response limits damage, and reduces recovery time and costs.
In the cloud, you need a systematic and organized approach.
This includes detective and responsive controls to help you with
prevention and to learn from previous incidents.
Detective controls provide visibility and transparency
over the operation of your AWS deployments.
Responsive controls drive remediation of potential deviations from your security baseline.
How can AWS help?
We have Amazon CloudTrail, S3 Access,
and VPC Flowlogs to track event history,
Amazon Detective to investigate and determine root causes.
And monitors such as Amazon GuardDuty, Macie,
IAM Access Analyzer, Inspector, and Security Hub.
In addition, Amazon Route 53 helps monitor
health checks and CloudWatch monitors for event alarms.
You can even use Windows Events, Linux syslogs,
and other application-specific log generation.
These are just a few ways AWS is partnering with you
to enable strong Incident Response.
To learn more, go to aws.amazon.com/security
